articles.title: Justice in the algorithm
articles.author: Mustafa Ali
articles.summary: In the new digital economy, data is the new oil. It knows the pulse of our hearts, the inflection of our voices and the tilt of our politics. The servers that feed AI's hunger for computation don't run on goodwill. They run on coal-fired electricity, on lithium mines that scar Indigenous land and on water siphoned from drought-prone regions. We're training machines to understand us while killing the planet. We need a green AI revolution.

Brands enter their website URL and MorningAI ingests thousands of data points about their brand, customers and products to begin executing personalized campaigns in minutes. MorningAI will be available in early 2026.

articles.title: The Download: OpenAI's caste bias problem, and how AI videos are made
articles.author: Rhiannon Williams
articles.summary: OpenAI's AI models are steeped in caste bias. Therapists are secretly using ChatGPT therapy. Taiwan has rejected America's chip demand and pushed back on a US request to move 50% of chip production to the States. Elon Musk claims to be building a Wikipedia rival.

articles.title: California AI Bill Sends Shock Waves Through The Industry
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: California's AI bill SB53 mandates transparency for advanced AI systems. It's aimed to safeguard innovation and set standards that may influence U.S. regulation for AI systems, as well as setting standards that might influence the regulation of AI systems in the United States.

articles.title: You can use ChatGPT for AI-driven online shopping
articles.author: Associated Press
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a chatbot that allows users to buy products from Etsy and Shopify. OpenAI is looking for new revenue in online commerce. It is working with payments company Stripe on the technical standards that will enable purchases through the "Instant Checkout" system.

articles.title: AI tool helps researchers treat child epilepsy
articles.author: The Daily Tribune
articles.summary: An artificial intelligence tool that can detect brain malformations in children with epilepsy could help them access life-changing surgery quicker. It is the latest example of how AI can crunch vast amounts of data and is changing healthcare by detecting problems that are often missed by doctors.

articles.title: Moving Beyond AI Tools To Build Agentic Growth Systems
articles.author: Raj Badarinath
articles.summary: Raj Badarinath is the Founder and CEO of Hivekind.ai, an agentic growth system company. He believes companies are focusing too much on individual tools instead of building integrated systems that compound their impact. He suggests a three-step strategy to implement AI in an organization.

articles.title: New Eastbridge research shows voluntary carriers expanding online capabilities
articles.author: Eastbridge Consulting Group
articles.summary: Few carriers use artificial intelligence to serve customers, according to the latest study from Eastbridge Consulting Group. Online chat, more analytics and reports on demand are among the top enhancements voluntary benefit carriers are making to their online services and capabilities, the study says.

articles.title: Bonterra Launches Que: The First Agentic AI Platform for Funders, Nonprofits, and Supporters
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: Bonterra Que is the first fully agentic AI platform purpose-built for the social good sector. Que helps nonprofits and foundations expand their capacity, raise more money, connect with the right partners, and accelerate progress toward their goals. Que's actions are guided by the people driving change.

articles.title: Why 1:1s Matter More Than Ever In The Age Of AI
articles.author: Elia Wallen
articles.summary: Elia Wallen is the CEO and Founder of Engine, a company reimaging business travel. He believes that regular 1:1s with your team members is essential to guide, focus and sharpen decisions. AI has expanded the field, not narrowed it, but people still need direction, feedback and context.

articles.title: Why Employees Overtrust Humanlike AI: Ignoring Its Flaws
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Companies that prioritize responsible AI practices are 60% more likely to achieve meaningful growth. Organizations with a strong AI governance framework have a 60% better chance of maximizing project success, according to IDC research. The rapid advancement of humanlike AI, exemplified by tools like Google Gemini, is reshaping the workplace. There is a growing concern that employees overtrust these systems, overlooking their flaws.

articles.title: HIX AI Unveils Major Upgrade with Smart Deep Research Agent & Chat-Based AI Image and Video Capabilities
articles.summary: HIX AI, the all-in-one AI chat and image, video and content creation platform, announced a significant product upgrade. It introduces deep research capabilities and enhanced AI image and video generation with a chat-based experience. New canvas preview functionality allows you to have a live preview of generated documents, images/videos within your chats.

articles.title: 'We're Screwed': Hollywood Not Happy About AI Actress
articles.author: Evann Gastaldo
articles.summary: Tilly Norwood is an AI actress created by Dutch actor and comedian Eline Van der Velden. The actors' union SAG-AFTRA has condemned her. Emily Blunt, Natasha Lyonne, and Whoopi Goldberg have also expressed concern about her.

articles.title: Apple asks judge to toss Musk's lawsuit over ChatGPT on iPhone
articles.author: Robert Hart
articles.summary: Apple's lawyers asked a federal judge to dismiss a lawsuit filed by Elon Musk's companies xAI and X Corp. in August. They accused Apple of rigging App Store rankings against chatbots and apps competing with OpenAI. Apple's lawyers said Musk's AI and social media companies had done nothing to 'plausibly' stand up their allegations.

articles.title: eBay and OpenAI want to train small businesses in getting the most out of AI
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: eBay will give 10,000 UK SMBs AI training and guidance, OpenAI throws in ChatGPT Enterprise for free, and OpenAI will give AI training to its AI platform to SMBs.    i.e. eBay will provide AI training for SMBs to their AI platform.

articles.title: AI Vs. Outsourcing: A Strategic Guide For Maximum Business Impact
articles.author: Cuong Nguyen Cao
articles.summary: Cuong Nguyen Cao is DCSMO at CMC Global, leading global expansion and strategic partnerships. According to Gartner, 80% of the work of today's project management discipline will be eliminated as AI takes on traditional functions by 2030. CMC's team guides businesses through this exact crossroads every day.

articles.title: Google Blocks Searches for Trump and Dementia
articles.author: Taegan Goddard
articles.summary: Google blocks AI search results for 'does Trump show signs of dementia' and other questions about his mental acuity. It will show AI results for similar searches about other presidents, however, even though it will show results for other searches about them as well.

articles.title: Chatbots New 'doc?' FAU Researchers Explore AI In Health Behavior Coaching
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Chatbots, apps and virtual agents can simulate the supportive, empathetic conversations at the heart of motivational interviewing. The most used AI tools were chatbots, with some virtual agents and mobile apps. Smoking cessation was the most common focus, followed by substance use reduction, stress management, and other health behaviors.

articles.title: Dataminr Announces Expanded Rollout of Agentic AI Offering
articles.summary: Dataminr has expanded the deployment of its Intel Agents offering to monitor and analyze real-time events in the physical world. Intel Agents are powered exclusively by Dataminr's in-house large language models trained on the company's 15-year archive of proprietary data and events.

articles.title: Will AI Eat Our Brains?
articles.author: Jeffrey A. Tucker
articles.summary: Doug McMillon, chief executive of WalMart, has said that artificial intelligence (AI) is disrupting every single job in the corporation at all levels. Many jobs will be eliminated, some created, and most all retooled in some way, according to McMillon.

articles.title: From barks to words: UT Arlington researchers aim to translate dog sounds with AI
articles.author: Miriam Fauzia
articles.summary: Kenny Zhu is a professor of computer science and engineering at UT Arlington. He uses AI to decipher dog sounds into phonemes and potential words. Zhu is also working on decoding the sounds of cats and cattle. He hopes the technology will help owners talk to their dogs.

articles.title: Encouraging Employee Adoption Of AI
articles.author: Elizabeth Baskin
articles.summary: Forbes Communications Council is an invitation-only community for executives in successful public relations, media strategy, creative and advertising agencies. CEO and Executive Creative Director at Tribe, Inc. works with large companies to align employees through internal communications to promote adoption of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: A ‘Godfather of AI' Remains Concerned as Ever About Human Extinction
articles.author: Isabelle Bousquette
articles.summary: Yoshua Bengio is a professor at Université de Montréal and the founder and scientific adviser of Mila, an AI research institute for Quebec. He also launched LawZero, a nonprofit research organization aimed at exploring how to build AI models that are truly safe. Bengio talks about the challenges of building safe AI and why today's race-style market conditions make it even harder.

articles.title: Durbin and Hawley introduce AI LEAD Act
articles.summary: Dick Durbin and Josh Hawley have introduced a bill aimed at holding artificial intelligence (AI) companies accountable for harm caused by their technology. It will be introduced by U.S. Senate Democratic Whip Dick Durbins (D-IL) and Sen. Hawley (R-MO).

articles.title: Wyoming baseload energy is Trump's secret weapon in AI war against China
articles.summary: President Trump's AI initiative officially launched in July with a bold and declarative message: America will lead the artificial intelligence revolution or we will cede our future to the Chinese Communist Party. This technological war won't be won or lost in Silicon Valley boardrooms or D.C. conference rooms. Wyoming energy is the key to winning this war.

articles.title: These fifth grade teachers are bringing AI to their Hayward classrooms
articles.author: Celia Hiorns
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is slowly making its way into local classrooms. Fifth grade teachers Sam Yoder and David Viner are using it to cut back on administrative tasks, save time and get more face-to-face engagement with their students. Kelly Ryder is the director of curriculum and programs for the Hayward Community School District.

articles.title: Hollywood Wants This 20-Year-Old 'Star' Cancelled: 8 Viral Photos of AI Actress Tilly Norwood Taking Over the Internet
articles.author: Ria Pathak
articles.summary: Tilly Norwood is an AI-generated actress created by Dutch comedian and producer Eline van der Velden. The project has sparked backlash from stars including Emily Blunt, Natasha Lyonne, and Whoopi Goldberg. SAG-AFTRA warned that AI characters like Norwood threaten the livelihoods of real performers.

articles.title: Data sharing challenges limit AI adoption in hospitality, new study finds
articles.author: Travel Daily News
articles.summary: Data sharing and integration remain the biggest obstacles to scaling artificial intelligence (AI) in hospitality. Most hotel chains are already experimenting with the technology. The study is called AI & Automation in Hospitality: Navigating Today's Challenges and Shaping Tomorrow's Gains.

articles.title: Five Levels Of Security Automation: A Model For The Human–AI SOC
articles.author: Ambuj Kumar
articles.summary: Ambuj Kumar is co-founder and CEO of Simbian, a mission-driven company solving security with AI. The average breach costs $4.4 million. The L0-L4 model for security automation is based on how the automotive industry assesses the different levels of self-driving cars.

articles.title: Why we need junior developers
articles.author: Info World
articles.summary: There is a movement to eliminate the role of the human being in the universe. I'm not worried about AI trying to destroy humankind, I'm worried about this unusual movement for AI eliminating the human role in society. I don't see Arnold Schwarzenegger showing up at my door in a leather jacket looking for Sarah Connor.

articles.title: California AI Bill Sends Shock Waves Through The Industry
articles.author: Paulo Carvão
articles.summary: Governor Gavin Newsom signed into law the Transparency in Frontier Artificial Intelligence Act. It requires leading AI companies to disclose details about their most advanced systems. Critics warn it could impose compliance burdens that will ripple through the industry nationwide. The law could establish a new baseline for AI standards across the United States.

articles.title: SAG-AFTRA criticizes AI-generated actress Tilly Norwood, the subject of a viral UK TV show parody, saying it opposes replacing performers with 'synthetics'
articles.author: Biz Toc
articles.summary: Tilly Norwood is an actress created using artificial intelligence (AI). The Screen Actors Guild of America (SAG-AFTRA) condemned the creation of the AI and said it was not an actor, but a computer program trained on countless human performances.

articles.title: Germany Is Investing Billions in AI: but Who Is Making a Profit?
articles.author: Euronews
articles.summary: The annual budget for artificial intelligence has grown 20 times since 2017, but profits are still late. Germany allocates EUR 1.6 billion for AI this year, one of the largest sums in the world. Experts warn that investments can be risky without clear and functional business models.

articles.title: 13 jobs that don't require a college degree − and won't be replaced by AI
articles.author: Dale Denwalt
articles.summary: There are 13 careers in Oklahoma that require only a high school diploma and pay at least $50,000 a year. The report draws on Bureau of Labor Statistics data. The careers offer good income and strong job security because they require skills beyond the capabilities of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Technology Innovation Institute unveils 'Manarat' control electronics platform
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: The Technology Innovation Institute (TII) has announced a milestone in fast electronics tailored for quantum computing with the launch of a quantum computer. The technology allows one to control quantum systems with extraordinary precision. It is the work of the applied research arm of Abu Dhabi's Advanced Technology Research Council.

articles.title: Maureen Dowd: AI will turn on us, inadvertently or nonchalantly
articles.author: Maureen Dowd
articles.summary: Elon Musk created Grok AI chatbots. Ani, designed in anime style, has big blue eyes and blond pigtails. She is sexy, flirty, ever-accommodating, with come-hither patter. Valentine is a hunky male 'companion' with a British accent.

articles.title: Tech View: AI continues to redefine the internet experience
articles.author: Chris Raker
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence applications are being integrated into our everyday lives. The effectiveness of AI applications is dependent upon a high-functioning network. Fiber optic cables transfer data using light signals through glass strands at faster speeds than traditional copper cables. Fiber networks' capability to offer symmetrical upload and download speeds is a necessity for AI applications.

articles.title: Cardiologist: Why AI can't fully explain your symptoms, and how to use it instead
articles.author: Natalia Osipova
articles.summary: Dr. Pierre Elias, New York-Presbyterian's Medical Director for Artificial Intelligence, talks to CNN's Clare Duffy about where AI outperforms human doctors and how to take advantage of AI during doctor visits. Listen and follow 'Terms of Service with Clare Duffy' wherever you get your podcasts.

articles.title: AI's Go-for-Broke Regulation Strategy
articles.author: John Herrman
articles.summary: OpenAI is planning to release a new version of its video generator that creates videos featuring copyright material unless rights holders opt out of having their work appear. Sam Altman would like to introduce AI 'privilege' to protect the rights of AI users when they talk to their chatbots.

articles.title: What 9 superstar designers actually want from AI
articles.author: Zachary Petit
articles.summary: Today's designers can rely on AI for some tasks, but it's not a silver bullet for the real problems they face. What do today's design leaders wish AI would take care of for them? We asked nine great designers that very question and got back interesting answers.

articles.title: A monk, Denver's mayor and Colorado's governor discuss AI governance in a tech world that is changing rapidly
articles.author: Tamara Chuang
articles.summary: Denver's mayor interviewed Tenzin Priyadarshi, a Buddhist monk about ethical artificial intelligence. Gov. Jared Polis talked about the state's AI law at the DenAI Summit, an AI conference hosted by the city of Denver. Polis supports a national law on AI, but Google prefers the California law.

articles.title: AI-Powered ETFs Aren't Living Up to Investor Expectations
articles.summary: The sales pitch for AI-powered ETFs was that algorithms could pick stocks more efficiently and logically than humans and less expensively. So far, most haven't lived up to investors' expectations. AI-driven strategies use algorithms to research and gather data on stocks and investments to select a fund's underlying holdings.

articles.title: Morning Laugh for Our Faithful Followers
articles.author: M Dowling
articles.summary: Hakeem Jeffries called the Donald Trump AI video racist. Donald Trump doubled down with the second video and made fun of Jeffries and Schumer. The second video has gone viral and has been shared by Mollie Don on Twitter.

articles.title: Are AI actors the future of film?
articles.author: Rory Kiberd
articles.summary: The idea of an AI actor playing a human character is absurd. It detracts from the whole concept of acting, which is to convey the wide array of human emotion and tell a story that people find compelling. Even if AI eventually became advanced enough to deliver performances indistinguishable from human actors, we wouldn't want to watch them. One potential concern is children's content.

articles.title: eBay and OpenAI Want to Train Small Businesses in Getting the Most Out of AI
articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: eBay UK is launching a new program aimed at helping small businesses harness the power of AI and compete with larger enterprises. AI Activate is a £3m investment that will provide up to 10,000 small enterprises with access to OpenAI-powered tools and tailored training to boost productivity and drive growth.

articles.title: Dispelling Agentic AI Myths: Essential Insights for CIOs
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: The global AI market is projected to reach $1.8 trillion by 2030. 90% of companies report their employees use personal chatbot and large language model (LLM) tools for daily tasks. CIOs are under increasing pressure to optimize resources, build resilience, and maintain a competitive edge.

articles.title: AI in the courtroom: Justice revolution or risk to rights?
articles.author: Anadolu Agency
articles.summary: 'We must ensure that AI strengthens justice rather than undermines fundamental rights,' says professor at John Jay College of Criminal Justice.    The courtroom, long defined by human judgment and professional expertise, is now facing a technological test: can artificial intelligence step into the role of an expert?

articles.title: Disney Forces Character.AI to Remove Copyrighted Chatbots After Cease-and-Desist Letter – [your]NEWS
articles.author: Blessing Nweke
articles.summary: Character.AI has removed Disney-themed chatbots from its platform. Disney accused the startup of exploiting its intellectual property without authorization. Character.AI said it acts 'swiftly' when notified of copyright violations and removed the disputed chatbots in response to Disney's request. Disney, Universal and Warner Bros. recently sued Chinese startup MiniMax.

articles.title: Why we need junior developers
articles.summary: There is a movement to eliminate the junior developer role. There is a lot of ink being spilled these days about how companies are not hiring junior developers and using AI to do the 'grunt work' that junior developers do. I think that's a bad idea.

articles.title: High-tech HH-60W Whiskey rescue helicopters replace aging Pave Hawks at Patrick Space Force Base
articles.author: Florida Today
articles.summary: The 920th Rescue Wing's HH-60W Jolly green II "Whiskey" helicopters are replacing the wing's Pave Hawks. The new helicopters feature advanced technology, including digital cockpits and autopilot capabilities similar to self-driving cars. The old helicopters were used in numerous high-profile rescue missions saving thousands of lives.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 5:03 a.m. EDT
articles.summary: FCC votes to end discounts for Wi-Fi hotspot lending and school bus connectivity. OpenAI has launched a new social media app called Sora. Amazon unveils its next generation of Kindle, Ring and Echo devices powered by artificial intelligence and connected to Alexa+. California police pull a self-driving Waymo taxi over an illegal U.S. turn.

articles.title: The Rise of Artificial Voices and the Threat of Deepfakes
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is capable of replicating human voices. It is almost impossible to distinguish an authentic recording from a digital imitation. According to research conducted by Queen Mary University of London, the evolution of artificial intelligence is no longer a science fictional one. The rise of artificial voices and the threat of deepfakes appeared in The Conversation.

articles.title: ‘It Was a Fatal Right-Wing Terrorist Incident': AI Chatbot Giants Claim Charlie Kirk's Killer Was Right-Wing but Say Left-Wing Violence Is ‘Exceptionally Rare'
articles.author: Alana Goodman
articles.summary: AI chatbots claim Charlie Kirk's assassination was motivated by right-wing ideology. They downplay left-wing violence as "exceptionally rare" in the U.S. Mainstream media sources say authorities are still searching for a motive in the Kirk's murder.

articles.title: AI's monstrous energy use is becoming a serious PR problem
articles.author: Pete Pachal
articles.summary: There are growing concerns about the environmental impact of AI and its use by knowledge workers. Google produced a report on the energy, carbon, and water footprint of its AI services. It's hard to be 'AI forward' if your workers think using it is a step backward for climate change.

articles.title: Study: Droughts, demand from AI, farming, pose risks for Great Lakes region water supplies
articles.author: Matthew Rink
articles.summary: Alliance for the Great Lakes' report warns of the growing water needs of data centers, critical minerals mining, and agriculture in the region. Data centers will use 150.4 billion gallons of water in the next five years, the equivalent of 4.6 million households.

articles.title: Thinking Strategically About AI And Warfare Via An Outside-The-Box Lawful Frame Of Mind
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Advanced AI is changing the nature of warfare. International rules and laws need to adjust. Recent research examines the stage of war preparations. An AI Insider scoop on the subject is available on their website here. It's called "An AI Insider Scoop".

articles.title: AI-powered imaging tool detects brain lesions in childhood epilepsy: study
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: Australian researchers have developed an artificial intelligence (AI) tool that detects tiny brain lesions causing severe epilepsy in children. The "AI epilepsy detective" can find focal cortical dysplasias, lesions. Neurosurgeons can develop a safer surgical roadmap to avoid important blood vessels and brain regions.

articles.title: Bainbridge School Board approves new AI policies
articles.summary: Bainbridge Island School Board approved policy updates on the use of Artificial Intelligence in the district. Capital projects, maintenance of existing structures and student transportation remain on track, but staffing changes and new amenities have added strain to some staff departments. Facility rental revenue is through the roof, up 236% from Aug. 2024.

articles.title: The Double-Edged Sword Of AI In The Classroom
articles.author: Lance Izumi
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a technology that can perform complex tasks normally done by human intelligence. AI tools in the education sector have taken several forms: chatbots, tutoring systems, writing assistants, teaching assistants, and teaching assistants. About a quarter of students regularly use AI tools, but many educators believe the real proportion is much higher. The biggest problem with AI in education is cheating. The public should demand transparency in AI usage in schools.

articles.title: WWE & McMahon Family Back Pediatric Cancer at White House
articles.author: Luis Mendoza
articles.summary: There are over 10,000 children diagnosed with cancer every year in the United States. Stephanie McMahon visited the White House with her mother Linda and husband Paul 'Triple H' Levesque in support of the Connor's Cure initiative. The initiative focuses on the development of AI-powered treatments for pediatric cancer.

articles.title: Dallas-Fort Worth is a leading data center market with a ‘significant scale issue'
articles.author: Lana Ferguson
articles.summary: Dallas-Fort Worth is in the midst of a data center boom driven by artificial intelligence. The spaces that house computer systems, servers, tech equipment and the infrastructure to support it all have existed for decades, but now they're getting more and more popular.

articles.title: AI Powers Pediatric Cancer Cure Breakthrough
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: This order orders the use of artificial intelligence (AI) to prevent and treat childhood diseases, including pediatric cancer. It also orders increasing investment in pediatric cancer research and advancements in care, and encouraging the private sector to make use of the most advanced technologies to unlock cures for childhood cancer.

articles.title: Why Businesses Are Turning to AI Meeting Assistants
articles.author: Matthew Kayser
articles.summary: US businesses are increasing their investment in AI-driven productivity software to offset labor costs and improve efficiency. AI-powered transcription tools have cut administrative workloads by double-digit percentages. AI meeting assistants are more than note-takers. They streamline project management by creating instant summaries and assigning action items.

articles.title: Commentary: Why academic debates about AI mislead lawmakers — and the public
articles.author: Kevin Frazier
articles.summary: There is a congressional hearing on artificial intelligence policy, but everyday Americans worry about job displacement, worker retraining, and community instability. Legislators get distracted by academic debates that don't address the challenges that directly affect people's lives, writes Julian Zelizer.

articles.title: Google Is Blocking AI Searches for Trump and Dementia
articles.summary: Google blocks AI search results for the query "does Trump show signs of dementia" when making a search about President Trump. It will show AI results for similar searches about other presidents, but not for this one. Go directly to AI Mode and you'll only receive a list of 10 web results.

articles.title: Madrid Audiovisual Cluster Tackles the Practical Uses of AI
articles.author: Variety
articles.summary: The real-world application of Artificial Intelligence (AI) on the audiovisual industry will take center stage in the coming year.   Controversy aside, the technology has potential to revolutionize the industry. For more information, go to: http://www.aia.org/.

articles.title: Publishers with AI licensing deals have seven times the clickthrough rate
articles.author: David Buttle
articles.summary: Publishers with OpenAI licensing deals benefit from a ChatGPT clickthrough rate almost seven times higher than those without agreements. The current wave of deals skew heavily towards English-language premium journalism from the largest media businesses on either side of the Atlantic. Small, non-English language and independent media have been largely shut out so far.

articles.title: Fare Dodging Fines Go up as NS Uses AI to Tighten the Net
articles.summary: The Dutch Railways is going to use artificial intelligence to catch fare dodgers. A member of the NS board says the following in a nutshell: "We are using smart technology like artificial intelligence" to catch people who refuse to pay for a ticket.

articles.title: Nothing unveils ‘Essential' AI platform: Know how it lets you build apps without coding
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: Nothing unveils its new artificial intelligence platform called Essential. It's the first step in building a personal operating system that relies on AI to make app creation simple and community-driven. Nothing promises unrestricted access, collective innovation, and hyper-personalisation.

articles.title: Botpool Expands AI-Powered Freelance Marketplace in 2026
articles.summary: Botpool, an AI-driven freelance marketplace, announced the expansion of its services in 2026 to give businesses new ways to access both AI-powered models and human professionals. The expansion introduces new categories in generative and conversational AI while continuing to support traditional freelance roles. Botpool's hybrid marketplace structure is intended to reduce project delivery times while maintaining quality.

articles.title: Trump Prioritizes AI to Tackle Pediatric Cancer Cures
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Today, President Trump signed an Executive Order to harness American AI innovation to unlock cures and prevention strategies for pediatric cancer and realize the potential of health data, together with AI, to transform clinical research and practice. The order instructs the MAHA Commission to work with the Assistant to the President for Science and Technology (APST) and the Special Advisor for AI and Crypto to develop innovative ways to use advanced technologies such as AI to unlock improved diagnoses, treatments and cures for childhood cancer.

articles.title: LinkedIn CEO says almost every 'super high stakes' email he sends is written with AI's help
articles.author: Lloyd Lee
articles.summary: LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslanksy uses AI when emailing his boss, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella. He uses Microsoft's Copilot AI assistant to help him with writing important emails. Gallup poll found that managers are using AI at twice the rate of individual contributors.

articles.title: Dream Vacations Named a 2025 Most Innovative Franchise by Franchise Business Review
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Dream Vacations has been named to Franchise Business Review's 2025 Most Innovative Franchises list. The recognition highlights the network's ongoing investment in technology, training, and tools that empower its travel advisors to thrive. Dream Vacations is now piloting a new AI Search Assistant within its Business Center.

articles.title: Planet Classroom Presents: Max Einhorn -- AI Filmmaking With Killer Kings
articles.author: Planet Classroom Network
articles.summary: Planet Classroom's groundbreaking series AI for a Better World debuts a new episode featuring Max Einhorn, co-founder and CEO of Gennie, in conversation with C.M. (Cathy) Rubin. Killer Kings, a six-part documentary series produced by FirstLookTV and distributed globally by Sphere Abacus, premiered on Sky HISTORY on June 16, 2025.

articles.title: Meet 'AI' actor Tilly Norwood and why are Hollywood stars like Emily Blunt outraged by her arrival
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: Emily Blunt is outraged by Tilly Norwood, an AI actor developed in the Netherlands. She has no life experience, no emotion, and no human artistry, according to Blunt. Norwood is now reportedly in talks with talent agencies in Hollywood.

articles.title: ‘AI actor' Tilly Norwood stirs outrage in Hollywood
articles.author: nypost
articles.summary: Tilly Norwood is an artificial intelligence-made character created by Xicoia, a company that bills itself as the world's first artificial intelligence talent studio. Since the Dutch producer and comedian Eline Van der Velden launched the digital character's prospective career, she has been all the talk in Hollywood. Guilds, actors and filmmakers have met the product with a wave of backlash, protesting that artificial intelligence should not have a starring role in the acting profession.

articles.title: Concentrix Launches ‘Agentic Operating Framework' to Scale Enterprise AI Projects
articles.author: Maham Fatima
articles.summary: Concentrix Corporation (NASDAQ:CNXC) is one of the oversold tech stocks to invest in. On September 18, Concentrix announced the launch of its Agentic Operating Framework. The Framework is specifically designed to help enterprises overcome common issues that lead to widespread failures in their AI pilot projects.

articles.title: Meta to Launch Ad-Free Subscription Option for Facebook, Instagram in the UK
articles.author: Maham Fatima
articles.summary: Meta Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META) will launch an ad-free subscription option for Facebook and Instagram users in the UK in the coming weeks. The company's ads business accounted for about $164.5 billion in revenue last year, with ads representing about 98% of that.

articles.title: Amazon VP Karthik Ramakrishnan, Key to Alexa Development, Steps Down Amid Senior AI Departures
articles.author: Maham Fatima
articles.summary: Karthik Ramakrishnan, Amazon's vice president of AI, has left the company after 13 years of service. His departure is the latest in a series of exits among Amazon's senior AI leadership. Other recent departures include Vasi Philomin, who oversaw generative AI projects, and Jon Jones, who led AWS's startups and venture capital division. Amazon has invested $8 billion in Anthropic, the developer of the Claude model.

articles.title: Who Gets a Ticket When No One's Driving?
articles.author: Rob Quinn
articles.summary: Waymo autonomous car made an illegal U-turn at a traffic light in San Bruno, California. The car did not have a driver behind the wheel, so the officers had to use the citation books without a "robot" checkbox. The department said in a Facebook post that there was no driver to ticket.

articles.title: 🌱 Patch AM: Fatal crash in Palo Alto raises safety concerns
articles.author: Patch AM Team
articles.summary: There was a fatal car crash in Palo Alto on September 27. A man in his forties died in the accident at Alma Street and University Avenue. The Moonlight Run is set for October 3. Palo Alto City Council has voted to join a lawsuit against the Trump Administration regarding illegal conditions on federal grant funds.

articles.title: AI Grading: Revolutionizing Feedback in Higher Education
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has emerged as a transformative force, redefining the dynamics of assessment in universities. AI can analyze vast amounts of data, predict outcomes and personalize experiences. The application of AI in grading is a good example of this.    .

articles.title: Agentic AI adopters expect quantum to shape marketing soon
articles.author: IT Brief Asia
